intro: Preussiella chevalieri, commonly known as the Chevalier's preussiella, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in sunny, arid environments. Its small, tubular flowers are usually a pale yellow or white, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Preussiella chevalieri is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
